intro: Angorkis ashantensis, commonly known as the Ashanti angorkis, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and elliptical, glossy leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
